intro: Lepidium heterophyllum subsp. heterophyllum, commonly known as the dwarf cress, is a small annual herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It typically grows to a height of 5–15 cm and has slender, branched stems covered with small, translucent glands. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by spherical, three-lobed seed pods. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. This species is adapted to harsh alpine environments and is often found in rocky or gravelly soils.
